FR: Il était une fois un vieux roi qui tomba malade.
GLOSS_LSF: UNE FOIS VIEUX ROI TOMBER MALADE
EN: There was once on a time an old king who was ill,
GENERATED_EN: Once upon a time, an old king fell ill.

FR: Sentant qu'il allait mourir,
GLOSS_LSF: ROI SENTIR LUI BIENTOT MOURIR
EN: and thought to himself, I am lying on what must be my death-bed.
GENERATED_EN: Feeling that he was going to die,

FR: il fit appeler le fidèle Jean : c'était son plus cher serviteur,
GLOSS_LSF: ROI APPELER FIDELE JEAN LUI PLUS FIDELE SERVITEUR
GENERATED_LSF: FIDELE JEAN FAIRE APPELER PLUS CHER SERVITEUR
EN: Then said he, Tell Faithful John to come to me. Faithful John was his favourite servant,
GENERATED_EN: he called for the faithful John, who was his dearest servant,

FR: et on le nommait ainsi parce que toute sa vie il avait été fidèle à son maître.
GLOSS_LSF: NOMMER CAR LUI TOUTE SA VIE FIDELE SON MAITRE
GENERATED_LSF: AINSI TOUTE VIE FIDELE MAITRE NOMMER
EN: and was so called, because he had for his whole life long been so true to him.
GENERATED_EN: and he was so called because all his life he had been faithful to his master.

FR: Quand il fut venu,
GLOSS_LSF: QUAND SERVITEUR ARRIVER
EN: When therefore he came beside the bed,
GENERATED_EN: When he came,

FR: le roi lui dit: Mon fidèle Jean,
GLOSS_LSF: ROI DIRE MON FIDELE JEAN
EN: the King said to him, Most faithful John,
GENERATED_EN: the king says to him: My faithful John,

FR: je sens que ma fin s'approche, je n'ai de souci qu'en songeant à mon fils;
GLOSS_LSF: MOI SENTIR BIENTOT FIN MOI SOUCI MON FILS
GENERATED_LSF: FIN SENTIR APPROCHE SOUCI FILS AVOIR SONGEANT
EN: I feel my end approaching, and have no anxiety except about my son.
GENERATED_EN: I feel that my end is approaching, I only worry about my son;

FR: il est encore bien jeune; il ne saura pas toujours se diriger;
GLOSS_LSF: LUI ENCORE JEUNE LUI PAS SAVOIR QUOI FAIRE PLUS TARD
GENERATED_LSF: ENCORE BIEN JEUNE NE PAS TOUJOURS SAVOIR DIRIGER
EN: He is still of tender age, and cannot always know how to guide himself.
GENERATED_EN: he is still very young; he will not always know how to direct himself;

FR: je ne mourrai tranquille que si tu me promets de veiller sur lui, de l'instruire de tout ce qu'il doit savoir, et d'être pour lui un second père.
GLOSS_LSF: MOI MOURIR PAIX SI TOI ME PROMETTRE TOI VEILLER SUR LUI L'ENSEIGNER TOUT LUI BESOIN SAVOIR DEVENIR DEUXIEME PERE POU LUI
GENERATED_LSF: NE TRANQUILLE TOI MOURIR PROMETTRE VEILLER INSTRUIRE TOUT DEVOIR SAVOIR SECOND PERE
EN: If thou dost not promise me to teach him everything that he ought to know, and to be his foster-father, I cannot close my eyes in peace.
GENERATED_EN: I will not die in peace unless you promise to watch over him, to teach him everything he needs to know, and to be a second father to him.

FR: Je vous promets, répondit Jean, de ne pas l'abandonner; je le servirai fidèlement, dût-il m'en coûter la vie.
GLOSS_LSF: JEAN REPONDRE MOI PROMETTRE MOI JAMAIS L'ABANDONNER MOI SERVIR LUI FIDELE MEME SI MOI DEVOIR MOURIR POUR LUI
GENERATED_LSF: PROMETTRE JEAN REPONDRE NE PAS ABANDONNER SERVIRAI FIDELEMER DUT VIE COUTER
EN: Then answered Faithful John, I will not forsake him, and will serve him with fidelity, even if it should cost me my life.
GENERATED_EN: I promise you, answered John, that I will not abandon him; I will serve him faithfully, even if it costs me my life.

FR: Je peux donc mourir en paix, dit le vieux roi.
GLOSS_LSF: ROI DIRE MOI POUVOIR MOURIR TRANQUILLE
GENERATED_LSF: DONC PAIX POUVOIR MOURIR VIEUX ROI DIRE
EN: On this, the old King said, Now I die in comfort and peace.
GENERATED_EN: So I can die in peace, said the old king.

FR: Après ma mort, tu lui feras voir tout le palais,
GLOSS_LSF: APRES MOI MORT TOI VISITER TOUT PALAIS MON FILS
EN: Then he added, After my death, thou shalt show him the whole castle:
GENERATED_EN: After my death, you will show him the whole palace,

FR: toutes les chambres, les salles, les souterrains avec les richesses qui y sont renfermées;
GLOSS_LSF: TOUTES CHAMBRES TOUTES SALLES SOUTERRAINS AVEC RICHESSES DEDANS
GENERATED_LSF: TOUTES CHAMBRES SALLES SOUTERRAINS RICHESSES RENFERMEES
EN: all the chambers, halls, and vaults, and all the treasures which lie therein,
GENERATED_EN: all the rooms, the halls, the subterranean with the riches which are contained there;

FR: seulement tu ne le laisseras pas entrer dans la dernière chambre de la grande galerie, où se trouve le portrait de la princesse du Dôme d'or.
GLOSS_LSF: MAIS TOI PAS LE LAISSER ENTRER DANS DERNIERE CHAMBRE GRANDE GALERIE DEDANS PORTRAIT PRINCESSE DOME OR
GENERATED_LSF: SEULEMENT NE LAISSERAS PAS DERNIERE CHAMBRE GRANDE GALERIE ENTRER PORTRAIT PRINCESSE DOME OR TROUVE
EN: but the last chamber in the long gallery, in which is the picture of the princess of the Golden Dwelling, shalt thou not show.
GENERATED_EN: only you will not let him enter the last room of the great gallery, where the portrait of the princess of the Golden Dome is.

FR: Car, s'il voit ce tableau, il ressentira pour elle un amour irrésistible
GLOSS_LSF: CAR SI LUI VOIR TABLEAU LUI DEVENIR TOMBER FOLLEMENT AMOUREUX
GENERATED_LSF: CAR TABLEAU VOIR AMOUR IRRESISTIBLE RESSENTIR
EN: If he sees that picture, he will fall violently in love with her,
GENERATED_EN: For, if he sees this painting, he will feel an irresistible love for her

FR: qui lui fera courir les plus grands dangers.
GLOSS_LSF: APPORTER DANGER POUR LUI
EN: and will drop down in a swoon, and go through great danger for her sake,
GENERATED_EN: that will put him in the greatest danger.

FR: Tâche de l'en préserver.
GLOSS_LSF: ESSAYER PROTEGER LUI
EN: therefore thou must preserve him from that.
GENERATED_EN: Try to keep it that way.

FR: Le fidèle Jean réitéra ses promesses, et le vieux roi, tranquillisé,
GLOSS_LSF: FIDELE JEAN REFAIRE PROMESSE CORRECTE VIEUX ROI TRANQUILLE
GENERATED_LSF: FIDELE JEAN PROMESSES REITERER VIEUX ROI TRANQUILLISE
EN: And when Faithful John had once more given his promise to the old King about this,
GENERATED_EN: The faithful John reiterated his promises, and the old king was reassured,

FR: posa sa tête sur l'oreiller et expira.
GLOSS_LSF: ROI TETE OREILLER POSER SOUFFLER
EN: the King said no more, but laid his head on his pillow, and died.
GENERATED_EN: put his head on the pillow and exhaled.

FR: Quand on eut mis le vieux roi au tombeau,
GLOSS_LSF: ENTERRER ROI
EN: When the old King had been carried to his grave,
GENERATED_EN: When the old king was put in the tomb,

FR: Jean raconta au jeune successeur ce qu'il avait promis à son père au lit de mort.
GLOSS_LSF: JEAN RACONTER JEUNE SUCCESSEUR LUI PORMETTRE SON PERE QUAND LUI MOURANT
GENERATED_LSF: JEAN JEUNE SUCCESSEUR PERE LIT MORT RACONTER PROMIS
EN: Faithful John told the young King all that he had promised his father on his deathbed,
GENERATED_EN: John told the young successor what he had promised his father on his deathbed.

FR: Je le tiendrai, ajouta-t-il, et je vous serai fidèle comme je l'ai été à votre père,
GLOSS_LSF: JEAN DIRE MOI TENIR MA PROMESSE MOI FIDELE COMME MOI FIDELE TON PERE
EN: and said, This will I assuredly perform, and will be faithful to thee as I have been faithful to him,
GENERATED_EN: I will keep it, he added, and I will be faithful to you as I was to your father,

FR: dût-il m'en coûter la vie.
GLOSS_LSF: MEME SI MOI DEVOIR MOURIR POUR
EN: even if it should cost me my life.
GENERATED_EN: even if it cost me my life.

FR: Après que le grand deuil fut passé,
GLOSS_LSF: APRES DEUIL FINIR
EN: When the mourning was over,
GENERATED_EN: After the great mourning was over,

FR: Jean dit au roi:
GLOSS_LSF: JEAN DIRE NOUVEAU ROI
EN: Faithful John said to him,
GENERATED_EN: John says to the king:

FR: Il est temps que vous connaissiez votre héritage.
GLOSS_LSF: MAINTENANT TOI CONNAITRE TON HERITAGE
EN: It is now time that thou shouldst see thine inheritance.
GENERATED_EN: It's time you knew your heritage.

FR: Je vais vous faire voir le palais de votre père.
GLOSS_LSF: MOI VISITER PALAIS TON PERE
EN: I will show thee thy father's palace.
GENERATED_EN: I will show you your father's palace.

FR: Il le conduisit partout,
GLOSS_LSF: AMENER PARTOUT
EN: Then he took him about everywhere,
GENERATED_EN: He drove him everywhere,

FR: du haut en bas,
GLOSS_LSF: HAUT BAS
EN: up and down,
GENERATED_EN: from top to bottom,

FR: et lui fit voir toutes les richesses
GLOSS_LSF: MONTRER TOUTES RICHESSES
EN: and let him see all the riches,
GENERATED_EN: and showed him all the riches

FR: et les splendides appartements,
GLOSS_LSF: MAGNIFIQUE APPARTEMENTS
EN: and the magnificent apartments,
GENERATED_EN: and the splendid apartments,

FR: en omettant seulement la chambre
GLOSS_LSF: SAUF CHAMBRE VIEUX ROI INTERDIR
EN: only there was one room which he did not open,
GENERATED_EN: omitting only the room

FR: où était le dangereux portrait.
GLOSS_LSF: DEDANS PORTRAIT DANGEREUX
EN: that in which hung the dangerous picture.
GENERATED_EN: where the dangerous portrait was.

FR: Il avait été placé de telle sorte que, lorsqu'on ouvrait la porte, on l'apercevait aussitôt,
GLOSS_LSF: PORTRAIT DEVANT PORTE ENTRER QUAND ENTRER DIRECTEMENT VOIR TABLEAU
GENERATED_LSF: TELLE SORTE PLACE PORTE OUVRIR AUSSITOT APERCEVOIR
EN: The picture was, however, so placed that when the door was opened you looked straight on it,
GENERATED_EN: It had been placed in such a way that when the door was opened, it was immediately visible,

FR: et il était si bien fait qu'il semblait vivre et respirer
GLOSS_LSF: PEINTURE BIEN FAIRE COMME VRAIE PERSONNE RESPIRER
GENERATED_LSF: SI BIEN VIVRE FAIT SEMBLER RESPIRER
EN: and it was so admirably painted that it seemed to breathe and live,
GENERATED_EN: and it was so well made that it seemed to live and breathe

FR: et que rien au monde n'était si beau ni si aimable.
GLOSS_LSF: RIEN AUTRE DANS MONDE PLUS BEAU AIMABLE
EN: and there was nothing more charming or more beautiful in the whole world.
GENERATED_EN: and that nothing in the world was so beautiful or so lovable.

FR: Le jeune roi vit bien que le fidèle Jean passait toujours devant cette porte sans l'ouvrir, et il lui demanda pourquoi.
GLOSS_LSF: JEUNE ROI VOIR JEAN PASSER DEVANT PORTE SANS JAMAIS OUVRIR LUI DEMANDER POURQUOI
GENERATED_LSF: JEUNE ROI BIEN FIDELE JEAN TOUJOURS PORTE VOIR PASSER OUVRIR DEMANDA POURQUOI
EN: The young King, however, plainly remarked that Faithful John always walked past this one door, and said, Why dost thou never open this one for me?
GENERATED_EN: The young king saw that the faithful John always passed by this door without opening it, and he asked him why.

FR: C'est, répondit l'autre, parce qu'il y a dans la chambre quelque chose qui vous ferait peur.
GLOSS_LSF: JEAN REPONDRE CAR DANS CHAMBRE LA QUELQUE CHOSE DONNER PEUR VOUS
GENERATED_LSF: REPONDRE CHAMBRE CHOSE PEUR AVOIR FAIRE
EN: There is something within it, he replied, which would terrify thee.
GENERATED_EN: It is, replied the other, because there is something in the room that would scare you.

FR: J'ai vu tout le château, dit le roi,
GLOSS_LSF: ROI DIRE FINIR VOIR TOUT CHATEAU
EN: But the King answered, I have seen all the palace,
GENERATED_EN: I have seen the whole castle, said the king,

FR: je veux savoir ce qu'il y a ici,
GLOSS_LSF: MOI VOULOIR SAVOIR QUOI DEDANS CHAMBRE
EN: and I will know what is in this room also,
GENERATED_EN: I want to know what's in here,

FR: et il voulait ouvrir de force.
GLOSS_LSF: VOULOIR OUVRIR PORTE FORCE
EN: and he went and tried to break open the door by force.
GENERATED_EN: and he wanted to open it by force.

FR: Le fidèle Jean le retint encore et lui dit:
GLOSS_LSF: FIDELE JEAN RETENIR ENCORE DIRE
EN: Then Faithful John held him back and said,
GENERATED_EN: The faithful John held him back again and said:

FR: J'ai promis à votre père, à son lit de mort, de ne pas vous laisser entrer dans cette chambre:
GLOSS_LSF: MOI PROMETTRE VOTRE PERE QUAND LUI MOURANT MOI PAS LAISSER VOUS ENTRER DANS CETTE CHAMBRE
GENERATED_LSF: PERE PROMIS LIT MORT NE PAS CHAMBRE LAISSER ENTRER
EN: I promised thy father before his death that thou shouldst not see that which is in this chamber,
GENERATED_EN: I promised your father, on his deathbed, that I would not let you into this room:

FR: il en pourrait résulter les plus grands malheurs pour vous et pour moi.
GLOSS_LSF: CONSEQUENCE POUVOIR APPORTER MALHEUR POUR VOUS PLUS POUR MOI
EN: it might bring the greatest misfortune on thee and on me.
GENERATED_EN: it could result in the greatest misfortune for you and for me.

FR: Le malheur le plus grand, répliqua le roi, c'est que ma curiosité ne soit pas satisfaite.
GLOSS_LSF: ROI REPONDRE GRAND MALHEUR POUR MOI MA CURIOSITE PAS FINIR
GENERATED_LSF: MALHEUR PLUS GRAND ROI REPLIQUER CURIOSITE NE PAS SATISFAITE ETRE
EN: Ah, no, replied the young King, if I do not go in, it will be my certain destruction.
GENERATED_EN: The greatest misfortune, replied the king, is that my curiosity is not satisfied.

FR: Je n'aurai de repos que lorsque mes yeux auront vu.
GLOSS_LSF: MOI PAS REPOSER SI MES YEUX PAS VOIR
EN: I should have no rest day or night until I had seen it with my own eyes.
GENERATED_EN: I will not rest until my eyes have seen.

FR: Je ne sors pas d'ici que tu ne m'aies ouvert.
GLOSS_LSF: MOI PAS SORTIR ICI SANS OUVRIR PORTE
GENERATED_LSF: NE PAS ICI NE OUVERT SORTIR AVOIR
EN: I shall not leave the place now until thou hast unlocked the door.
GENERATED_EN: I don't leave here until you open the door.

FR: Le fidèle Jean, voyant qu'il n'y avait plus moyen de s'y refuser,
GLOSS_LSF: FIDELE JEAN VOIR AUCUN AUTRE MOYEN REFUSER
GENERATED_LSF: FIDELE JEAN PLUS MOYEN VOYANT REFUSER
EN: Then Faithful John saw that there was no help for it now,
GENERATED_EN: The faithful John, seeing that there was no longer any way to refuse,

FR: alla, le coeur bien gros et en soupirant beaucoup,
GLOSS_LSF: COEUR LOURD BEAUCOUP SOUPIRER
GENERATED_LSF: ALLER COEUR BIEN GROS BEAUCOUP SOUPIRANT
EN: and with a heavy heart and many sighs,
GENERATED_EN: went, with a heavy heart and sighing a lot,

FR: chercher la clef au grand trousseau.
GLOSS_LSF: ALLER CHERCHER CLE DANS TROUSSEAU
EN: sought out the key from the great bunch.
GENERATED_EN: to look for the key to the big bunch of keys.

FR: Quand la porte fut ouverte, il entra le premier,
GLOSS_LSF: QUAND PORTE OUVERTE FIDELE JEAN ENTRER PREMIER
EN: When he had opened the door, he went in first,
GENERATED_EN: When the door was opened, he entered first,

FR: tâchant de cacher le portrait avec son corps; tout fut inutile:
GLOSS_LSF: ESSAYER CACHER PORTRAIT AVEC SON CORPS MAIS INUTILE
GENERATED_LSF: PORTRAIT CORPS TACHANT CACHER TOUT INUTILE
EN: and thought by standing before him he could hide the portrait so that the King should not see it in front of him, but what availed that?
GENERATED_EN: trying to hide the portrait with his body; all was useless:

FR: le roi, en se dressant sur la pointe des pieds, l'aperçut par-dessus son épaule.
GLOSS_LSF: ROI DRESSER POINTE PIED APERCEVOIR PORTRAIT
GENERATED_LSF: ROI POINTE PIEDS DRESSANT APERCUT DESSUS EPAULE
EN: The King stood on tip-toe and saw it over his shoulder.
GENERATED_EN: the king, standing on tiptoe, saw it over his shoulder.

FR: Mais en voyant cette image de jeune fille si belle
GLOSS_LSF: MAIS VOIR IMAGE FILLE MAGNIFIQUE
EN: And when he saw the portrait of the maiden,
GENERATED_EN: But seeing this image of a young girl so beautiful

FR: et si brillante d'or et de pierreries,
GLOSS_LSF: BRILLER OR PIERRE
EN: which was so magnificent and shone with gold and precious stones,
GENERATED_EN: and so shiny with gold and gems,

FR: il tomba sans connaissance sur le parquet.
GLOSS_LSF: TOMBER POMME
EN: he fell fainting to the ground.
GENERATED_EN: he fell unconscious on the floor.

FR: Le fidèle Jean le releva et le porta sur son lit,
GLOSS_LSF: FIDELE JEAN LE RELEVER PORTER SUR SON LIT
EN: Faithful John took him up, carried him to his bed,
GENERATED_EN: The faithful John picked him up and carried him to his bed,

FR: tout en murmurant:
GLOSS_LSF: MEME TEMPS MURMURER
EN: and sorrowfully thought,
GENERATED_EN: while whispering:

FR: Le malheur est fait;
GLOSS_LSF: VOILA MALHEUR FAIT
EN: The misfortune has befallen us,
GENERATED_EN: The misfortune is done;

FR: grand Dieu! qu'allons-nous devenir?
GLOSS_LSF: DIEU NOUS DEVENIR QUOI ?
EN: Lord God, what will be the end of it?
GENERATED_EN: What will become of us?

FR: et il lui fit prendre un peu de vin pour le réconforter.
GLOSS_LSF: DONNER BOIRE VIN POUR RASSURER
EN: Then he strengthened him with wine,
GENERATED_EN: and he made him take some wine to comfort him.

FR: Le premier mot du roi, quand il revint à lui,
GLOSS_LSF: PREMIER MOT ROI APRES REPRENDRE CONNAISSANCE
EN: until he came to himself again. The first words the King said were,
GENERATED_EN: The first word of the king, when he came to,

FR: fut pour demander quel était ce beau portrait.
GLOSS_LSF: POUR DEMANDER QUI FILLE SUR TABLEAU
EN: Ah, the beautiful portrait! whose it it?
GENERATED_EN: was to ask what this beautiful portrait was.

FR: C'est celui de la princesse du Dôme d'or, répondit le fidèle Jean.
GLOSS_LSF: FIDELE JEAN REPONDRE ELLE PRINCESSE DOME OR
GENERATED_LSF: PRINCESSE DOME OR FIDELE JEAN REPONDRE
EN: That is the princess of the Golden Dwelling, answered Faithful John.
GENERATED_EN: It's the Princess of the Golden Dome's, replied the faithful John.

FR: Mon amour pour elle est si grand, continua le roi,
GLOSS_LSF: ROI REPRENDRE MON AMOUR POUR ELLE TELLEMENT GRAND
EN: Then the King continued, My love for her is so great,
GENERATED_EN: My love for her is so great, continued the king,

FR: que, si toutes les feuilles des arbres étaient des langues, elles ne suffiraient pas à l'exprimer.
GLOSS_LSF: QUE SI TOUTES FEUILLES ARBRES LANGUE PAS SUFFISSANT POUR EXPRIMER MON AMOUR
GENERATED_LSF: TOUTES FEUILLES ARBRES LANGUES NE PAS SUFFIRE EXPRIMER
EN: that if all the leaves on all the trees were tongues, they could not declare it.
GENERATED_EN: that, if all the leaves of the trees were languages, they would not be enough to express it.

FR: Ma vie tient désormais à sa possession.
GLOSS_LSF: MA VIE MAINTENANT ELLE POSSEDER
EN: I will give my life to win her.
GENERATED_EN: My life now depends on its possession.

FR: Tu m'aideras, toi qui es mon fidèle serviteur.
GLOSS_LSF: TOI M'AIDER FIDELE SERVITEUR
EN: Thou art my most Faithful John, thou must help me.
GENERATED_EN: You will help me, you who are my faithful servant.

FR: Le fidèle Jean réfléchit longtemps à la manière dont il convenait de s'y prendre,
GLOSS_LSF: FIDELE JEAN REFLECHIR LONGTEMPS POUR SAVOIR COMMENT FAIRE
GENERATED_LSF: FIDELE JEAN LONGTEMPS MANIERE REFLECHIR CONVENIR PRENDRE
EN: The faithful servant considered within himself for a long time how to set about the matter,
GENERATED_EN: The faithful John thought for a long time about how to go about it,

FR: car il était difficile même de se présenter devant les yeux de la princesse.
GLOSS_LSF: CAR COMPLIQUE D'ALLER DEVANT PRINCESSE
EN: for it was difficult even to obtain a sight of the King's daughter.
GENERATED_EN: for it was difficult even to present oneself before the eyes of the princess.

FR: Enfin, il imagina un moyen,
GLOSS_LSF: FIDELE JEAN TROUVER MOYEN
EN: At length he thought of a way,
GENERATED_EN: Finally, he thought of a way,

FR: et dit au roi:
GLOSS_LSF: SERVITEUR DIRE ROI
EN: and said to the King,
GENERATED_EN: and said to the king:

FR: Tout ce qui entoure la princesse est d'or, chaises, plats, tables, gobelets, meubles de toute espèce.
GLOSS_LSF: TOUTE CHOSE AUTOUR PRINCESSE OR EX CHAISE TABLE PLATS GOBELETS MEUBLES TOUT OR
GENERATED_LSF: TOUT PRINCESSE OR ENTOURE CHAISES PLATS TABLES GOBELETS MEUBLES ESPECE
EN: Everything which she has about her is of gold tables, chairs, dishes, glasses, bowls, and household furniture.
GENERATED_EN: Everything around the princess is golden, chairs, dishes, tables, cups, furniture of all kinds.

FR: Vous avez cinq tonnes d'or dans votre trésor;
GLOSS_LSF: NOUS ICI 5 TONNES OR
EN: Among thy treasures are five tons of gold;
GENERATED_EN: You have five tons of gold in your treasury;

FR: il faut en confier une aux orfèvres pour qu'ils vous en fassent des vases et des bijoux d'or de toutes les façons,
GLOSS_LSF: FALLOIR CONFIER ORFEVRE POUR EUX FAIRE VASES BIJOUX OR DIFFERENT PLUSIEURS
GENERATED_LSF: ORFEVRES FASSENT VASES BIJOUX TOUTES FACONS FALLOIR CONFIER
EN: let one of the goldsmiths of the Kingdom work these up into all manner of vessels and utensils,
GENERATED_EN: you have to entrust one to the goldsmiths so that they can make vases and gold jewels for you in every way,

FR: des oiseaux, des bêtes sauvages, des monstres de mille formes;
GLOSS_LSF: OISEAUX BETES SAUVAGES MONSTRES MILLE FORMES DIFFERENTS
GENERATED_LSF: OISEAUX BETES SAUVAGES MONSTRES MILLE FORMES
EN: into all kinds of birds, wild beasts and strange animals,
GENERATED_EN: birds, wild beasts, monsters of a thousand forms;

FR: tout cela doit plaire à la princesse.
GLOSS_LSF: TOUT DEVOIR PLAIRE PRINCESSE
EN: such as may please her,
GENERATED_EN: all this must please the princess.

FR: Nous nous mettrons en route avec ce bagage, et nous tâcherons de réussir.
GLOSS_LSF: NOUS PARTIR ROUTE AVEC TOUT OR ESSAYER REUSSIR
EN: and we will go there with them and try our luck.
GENERATED_EN: We'll set out with that baggage, and we'll try to succeed.

FR: Le roi fit venir tous les orfèvres du pays,
GLOSS_LSF: ROI APPELER TOUS ORFEVRES PAYS
GENERATED_LSF: ROI FIT TOUS ORFEVRES PAYS VENIR
EN: The King ordered all the goldsmiths to be brought to him,
GENERATED_EN: The king sent for all the goldsmiths of the country,

FR: et ils travaillèrent nuit et jour jusqu'à ce que tout fût prêt.
GLOSS_LSF: EUX TRAVAILLER NUIT JOUR POUR TOUT PRET
EN: and they had to work night and day until at last the most splendid things were prepared.
GENERATED_EN: and they worked night and day until everything was ready.

FR: Quand on en eut chargé un navire,
GLOSS_LSF: QUAND NAVIR CHARGE
EN: When everything was stowed on board a ship,
GENERATED_EN: When a ship was loaded with it,

FR: le fidèle Jean prit des habits de marchand,
GLOSS_LSF: FIDELE JEAN PRENDRE VETEMENT MARCHAND
EN: Faithful John put on the dress of a merchant,
GENERATED_EN: the faithful Jean took clothes of merchant,

FR: et le roi en fit autant, pour que personne ne put le reconnaître.
GLOSS_LSF: ROI PAREIL COMME CA PERSONNE RECONNAITRE LUI
GENERATED_LSF: ROI FIT AUTANT NE PUT PERSONNE RECONNAITRE
EN: and the King was forced to do the same in order to make himself quite unrecognizable.
GENERATED_EN: and the king did the same, so that nobody could recognize him.

FR: Puis ils mirent à la voile
GLOSS_LSF: BATEAU PARTIR
EN: Then they sailed across the sea,
GENERATED_EN: Then they set sail

FR: et naviguèrent jusqu'à la ville où demeurait la princesse du Dôme d'or.
GLOSS_LSF: NAVIGUER JUSQU’ A VILLE PRINCESSE DOME OR VIVRE
GENERATED_LSF: NAVIGUERENT VILLE PRINCESSE DOME OR DEMEURER
EN: and sailed on until they came to the town wherein dwelt the princess of the Golden Dwelling.
GENERATED_EN: and sailed to the city where the Princess of the Golden Dome lived.

FR: Le fidèle Jean débarqua seul et laissa le roi dans le navire.
GLOSS_LSF: FIDELE JEAN DESCENDRE SEUL LAISSER ROI DANS NAVIRE
GENERATED_LSF: FIDELE JEAN SEUL LAISSA ROI NAVIRE DEBARQUER
EN: Faithful John bade the King stay behind on the ship, and wait for him.
GENERATED_EN: The faithful John disembarked alone and left the king in the ship.

FR: Peut-être, lui dit-il, ramènerai-je la princesse;
GLOSS_LSF: SERVITEUR DIRE PEUT ETRE MOI RAMENER PRINCESSE
EN: Perhaps I shall bring the princess with me, said he,
GENERATED_EN: Perhaps, he said, I will bring back the princess;

FR: ayez soin que tout soit en ordre,
GLOSS_LSF: VOUS OCCUPER TOUT PRET QUAND ELLE ARRIVER
EN: therefore see that everything is in order;
GENERATED_EN: make sure everything is in order,

FR: que les vases d'or soient exposés et que le navire soit paré et en fête.
GLOSS_LSF: VASES OR EXPOSE NAVIRE PRET BEAU
EN: have the golden vessels set out and the whole ship decorated.
GENERATED_EN: that the golden vessels be exposed and that the ship be adorned and feted.

FR: Là-dessus il remplit sa ceinture de plusieurs petits bijoux d'or,
GLOSS_LSF: FIDELE JEAN REMPLIR SACOCHE PLUSIEURS PETITS BIJOUX
GENERATED_LSF: LA DESSUS CEINTURE PETITS BIJOUX OR REMPLIR
EN: Then he gathered together in his apron all kinds of gold things,
GENERATED_EN: Then he filled his belt with several small gold jewels,

FR: et se rendit directement au palais du roi.
GLOSS_LSF: ALLER DIRECTEMENT PALAIS ROI
EN: went on shore and walked straight to the royal palace.
GENERATED_EN: and went directly to the king's palace.

FR: Il vit en entrant dans la cour
GLOSS_LSF: ENTRER COUR VOIR
EN: When he entered the courtyard of the palace,
GENERATED_EN: He saw as he entered the courtyard

FR: une jeune fille qui puisait de l'eau à une fontaine avec deux seaux d'or.
GLOSS_LSF: JEUNE FILLE PUISER EAU DANS FONTAINE AVEC DEUX SEAUX OR
GENERATED_LSF: JEUNE FILLE EAU FONTAINE DEUX SEAUX OR PUISER
EN: a beautiful girl was standing there by the well with two golden buckets in her hand, drawing water with them.
GENERATED_EN: a young girl drawing water from a fountain with two golden buckets.

FR: Comme elle se retournait pour s'en aller, elle aperçut l'étranger
GLOSS_LSF: ELLE RETOURNER POUR PARTIR ELLE VOIR ETRANGER
EN: And when she was just turning round to carry away the sparkling water she saw the stranger,
GENERATED_EN: As she turned to leave, she saw the stranger

FR: et lui demanda qui il était.
GLOSS_LSF: ELLE DEMANDER QUI LUI ?
EN: and asked who he was.
GENERATED_EN: and asked him who he was.

FR: Je suis marchand, répondit-il;
GLOSS_LSF: FIDELE JEAN REPONDRE MOI MARCHAND
EN: So he answered, I am a merchant,
GENERATED_EN: I am a merchant, he replied;

FR: et ouvrant sa ceinture, il lui fit voir ses marchandises.
GLOSS_LSF: OUVRIR SA SACOCHE MONTRER MARCHANDISE
EN: and opened his apron, and let her look in.
GENERATED_EN: and opening his belt, he showed him his goods.

FR: Que de belles choses! s'écria-t-elle;
GLOSS_LSF: FILLE DIRE WOW QUE BELLE CHOSE !
EN: Then she cried, Oh, what beautiful gold things!
GENERATED_EN: What beautiful things! she exclaimed;

FR: et, posant ses seaux à terre, elle se mit à considérer tous les bijoux les uns après les autres.
GLOSS_LSF: POSER SEAUX REGARDER PRES MARCHANDISES
GENERATED_LSF: SEAUX TERRE POSANT TOUS BIJOUX UNS AUTRES METTRE CONSIDERER
EN: and put her pails down and looked at the golden wares one after the other.
GENERATED_EN: and, putting her buckets on the ground, she began to consider all the jewels one after the other.

FR: Il faut, dit-elle,
GLOSS_LSF: FILLE DIRE OBLIGER
EN: Then said the girl,
GENERATED_EN: It is necessary, she says,

FR: que la princesse voie tout cela;
GLOSS_LSF: PRINCESSE VOIR CA
EN: The princess must see these,
GENERATED_EN: that the princess sees all this;

FR: elle vous l'achètera, elle qui aime tant les objets d'or.
GLOSS_LSF: ELLE ACHETER ELLE ADORER OBJETS OR
EN: she has such great pleasure in golden things, that she will buy all you have.
GENERATED_EN: she will buy it from you, she who loves gold objects so much.

FR: Et, le prenant par la main, elle le fit monter dans le palais,
GLOSS_LSF: PRENDRE MAIN SERVITEUR MONTER DANS PALAIS
EN: She took him by the hand and led him upstairs,
GENERATED_EN: And, taking him by the hand, she made him go up in the palace,

FR: car c'était une femme de chambre.
GLOSS_LSF: CAR FILLE ELLE FEMME CHAMBRE
EN: for she was the waiting-maid.
GENERATED_EN: because she was a maid.

FR: La princesse fut ravie de voir les bijoux, et elle dit:
GLOSS_LSF: PRINCESSE CONTENTE VOIR BIJOUX ELLE DIRE
EN: When the King's daughter saw the wares, she was quite delighted and said,
GENERATED_EN: The princess was delighted to see the jewels, and she said:

FR: Tout cela est si bien travaillé que je l'achète.
GLOSS_LSF: BIJOUX BIEN TRAVAILLE MOI ACHETER
EN: They are so beautifully worked, that I will buy them all of thee.
GENERATED_EN: It's all so well done that I'm buying it.

FR: Mais le fidèle Jean répondit:
GLOSS_LSF: FIDELE JEAN REPONDRE
EN: But Faithful John said,
GENERATED_EN: But the faithful John answered:

FR: Je ne suis que le serviteur d'un riche marchand;
GLOSS_LSF: MOI UNIQUEMENT SERVITEUR MARCHAND RICHE
EN: I am only the servant of a rich merchant.
GENERATED_EN: I am only the servant of a rich merchant;

FR: tout ce que vous voyez ici n'est rien auprès de ce que mon maître a dans son navire;
GLOSS_LSF: TOUT VOUS VOIR ICI RIEN COMPARER MON MAITRE AVOIR DANS SON NAVIRE
GENERATED_LSF: TOUT ICI AUPRES MAITRE NAVIRE VOIR AVOIR
EN: The things I have here are not to be compared with those my master has in his ship.
GENERATED_EN: everything you see here is nothing compared to what my master has in his ship;

FR: vous y verrez les ouvrages les plus beaux et les plus précieux.
GLOSS_LSF: POUVOIR VOIR PLUS BEAU OUVRAGES PLUS PRECIEUX
GENERATED_LSF: OUVRAGES PLUS BEAUX PLUS PRECIEUX VOIR
EN: They are the most beautiful and valuable things that have ever been made in gold.
GENERATED_EN: you will see the most beautiful and precious works.

FR: Elle voulait se les faire apporter,
GLOSS_LSF: ELLE VOULOIR APPORTER DANS SON PALAIS
EN: She wanted to have everything brought to her there,
GENERATED_EN: She wanted to have them brought to her,

FR: mais il dit: Il y en a trop, il faudrait trop de temps et trop de place;
GLOSS_LSF: FIDELE JEAN DIRE NON PAS POSSIBLE TROP OBJETS TROPS TEMPS TROP PLACE
GENERATED_LSF: DIRE TROP TROP TEMPS TROP PLACE FALLOIR
EN: but he said, There are so many of them that it would take a great many days to do that,
GENERATED_EN: but he says: There are too many, it would take too much time and too much space; There are too many, it would take too much time and too much space;

FR: votre palais n'y suffirait pas.
GLOSS_LSF: VOTRE PALAIS PAS SUFFIR
EN: and so many rooms would be required to exhibit them, that your house is not big enough.
GENERATED_EN: your palate would not be enough.

FR: Sa curiosité n'en était que plus excitée,
GLOSS_LSF: CURIOSITE PRINCESSE AUGMENTER
EN: Then her curiosity and longing were still more excited,
GENERATED_EN: His curiosity was only heightened, Well, take me to that ship,

FR: et enfin elle s'écria: Eh bien! conduis-moi à ce navire,
GLOSS_LSF: PRINCESSE DIRE EH BIEN ! TOI M' AMENER TON NAVIRE
EN: until at last she said, Conduct me to the ship,
GENERATED_EN: and finally she cried out: Well, take me to that ship,

FR: je veux aller moi-même voir les trésors de ton maître.
GLOSS_LSF: MOI VOULOIR VOIR TRESORS TON MAITRE
GENERATED_LSF: MEME TRESORS TON MAITRE VOULOIR ALLER VOIR
EN: I will go there myself, and behold the treasures of thine master.
GENERATED_EN: I want to go myself to see the treasures of your master.

FR: Le fidèle Jean la mena tout joyeux au navire,
GLOSS_LSF: FIDELE JEAN CONTENT AMENER PRINCESSE NAVIRE
GENERATED_LSF: FIDELE JEAN MENA TOUT JOYEUX NAVIRE
EN: On this Faithful John was quite delighted, and led her to the ship,
GENERATED_EN: The faithful John led her joyfully to the ship,

FR: et le roi, en la voyant,
GLOSS_LSF: ROI VOIR PRINCESSE
EN: and when the King saw her,
GENERATED_EN: and the king, on seeing her,

FR: la trouva encore plus belle que son portrait; le coeur lui en bondissait de joie.
GLOSS_LSF: TROUVER ENCORE PLUS BELLE QUE PORTRAIT COEUR BONDIR JOIE
GENERATED_LSF: TROUVA ENCORE PLUS BELLE PORTRAIT COEUR JOIE BONDIR
EN: he perceived that her beauty was even greater than the picture had represented it to be, and thought no other than that his heart would burst in twain.
GENERATED_EN: found her even more beautiful than her portrait; his heart leapt with joy.

FR: Quand elle fut montée à bord,
GLOSS_LSF: PRINCESSE MONTER BATEAU
EN: Then she got into the ship,
GENERATED_EN: When she was on board,

FR: le roi lui offrit la main;
GLOSS_LSF: ROI OFFRIR MAIN
EN: and the King led her within.
GENERATED_EN: the king offered him his hand;

FR: pendant ce temps-là, le fidèle Jean, qui était resté derrière, ordonna au capitaine de lever l'ancre à l'instant
GLOSS_LSF: MEME TEMPS FIDELE JEAN RESTER DERRIER ORDONNER CAPITAINE LEVER ANCRE
GENERATED_LSF: TEMPS -LA FIDELE JEAN RESTE ORDONNA CAPITAINE ANCRE INSTANT LEVER
EN: Faithful John, however, remained behind with the pilot, and ordered the ship to be pushed off, saying,
GENERATED_EN: meanwhile, the faithful John, who had remained behind, ordered the captain to weigh anchor at once

FR: et de fuir à toutes voiles.
GLOSS_LSF: PARTIR VITE
EN: Set all sail, till it fly like a bird in air.
GENERATED_EN: and to flee with all sails.

FR: Le roi était descendu avec elle dans la chambre et lui montrait une à une toutes les pièces de la vaisselle d'or,
GLOSS_LSF: ROI DESCENDRE AVEC ELLE DANS CHAMBRE BATEAU MONTRER UNE PAR UNE TOUTES PIECES VAISSELLE OR
GENERATED_LSF: ROI CHAMBRE TOUTES PIECES VAISSELLE OR DESCENDU MONTRER
EN: Within, however, the King showed her the golden vessels,
GENERATED_EN: The king had gone down with her into the room and was showing her one by one all the pieces of the golden dishes,

FR: les plats, les coupes, les oiseaux, les bêtes sauvages et les monstres.
GLOSS_LSF: PLATS COUPE OISEAUX BETE SAUVAGES MONSTRES TOUT MONTRER
GENERATED_LSF: PLATS COUPES OISEAUX BETES SAUVAGES MONSTRES
EN: every one of them, also the wild beasts and strange animals.
GENERATED_EN: dishes, cups, birds, wild beasts and monsters.

FR: Plusieurs heures se passèrent ainsi, et, pendant qu'elle était occupée à tout examiner,
GLOSS_LSF: PLUSIEURS HEURES PASSER ELLE OCCUPER EXAMINER TOUT OBJET
GENERATED_LSF: HEURES AINSI PASSER TOUT OCCUPEE EXAMINER
EN: Many hours went by whilst she was seeing everything,
GENERATED_EN: Several hours passed in this way, and while she was busy examining everything,

FR: elle ne s'apercevait pas que le navire marchait.
GLOSS_LSF: ELLE PAS SE RENDRE COMPTE BATEAU NAVIGUER
EN: and in her delight she did not observe that the ship was sailing away.
GENERATED_EN: she did not notice that the ship was moving.

FR: Quand elle eut fini,
GLOSS_LSF: QUAND ELLE FINIR
EN: After she had looked at the last,
GENERATED_EN: When she finished,

FR: elle remercia le prétendu marchand et se disposa à retourner dans son palais;
GLOSS_LSF: REMERCIER FAUX MARCHAND PRETE RETOURNER DANS SON PALAIS
GENERATED_LSF: PRETENDU MARCHAND PALAIS REMERCIA DISPOSER RETOURNER
EN: she thanked the merchant and wanted to go home,
GENERATED_EN: she thanked the pretended merchant and prepared to return to her palace;

FR: mais, arrivée sur le pont,
GLOSS_LSF: MAIS SUR LE PONT
EN: but when she came to the side of the ship,
GENERATED_EN: but, arrival on the bridge,

FR: elle s'aperçut qu'elle était en pleine mer,
GLOSS_LSF: S'APERCEVOIR ELLE MILIEU MER
EN: she saw that it was on the deep sea far from land,
GENERATED_EN: she realized that she was in the middle of the sea,

FR: bien loin de la terre, et que le navire cinglait à pleines voiles.
GLOSS_LSF: LOIN TERRE NAVIRE AVANCER VITE
GENERATED_LSF: BIEN LOIN TERRE NAVIRE PLEINES VOILES CINGLER
EN: and hurrying onwards with all sail set.
GENERATED_EN: far from the land, and the ship was making full sail.

FR: Je suis trahie! s'écria-t-elle dans son effroi;
GLOSS_LSF: PRINCESSE CRIER PEUR OH TRAHISON
EN: Ah, cried she in her alarm, I am betrayed!
GENERATED_EN: I am betrayed! she cried in her fright;

FR: on m'emmène! Être tombée au pouvoir d'un marchand? J'aimerais mieux mourir.
GLOSS_LSF: VOUS M'ENLEVER ! MOI SOUS ORDRE MARCHAND ? MOI PREFERER MOURIR
GENERATED_LSF: TOMBEE MARCHAND MIEUX EMMENER POUVOIR AIMER MOURIR
EN: I am carried away and have fallen into the power of a merchant I would die rather!
GENERATED_EN: I am being taken away! To have fallen into the power of a merchant? I would rather die.

FR: Mais le roi lui dit en lui prenant la main: Je ne suis pas marchand;
GLOSS_LSF: MAIS ROI PRENDRE MAIN PRINCESSE DIRE MOI PAS VOTRE MARCHAND
GENERATED_LSF: ROI MAIN DIRE PRENANT NE PAS MARCHAND
EN: The King, however, seized her hand, and said, I am not a merchant.
GENERATED_EN: But the king said to him, taking his hand, I am not a merchant;

FR: je suis roi, et d'une aussi bonne famille que la vôtre.
GLOSS_LSF: MOI ROI FAMILLE BONNE COMME VOTRE
EN: I am a king, and of no meaner origin than thou art,
GENERATED_EN: I am a king, and from a family as good as yours.

FR: Si je vous ai enlevée par ruse,
GLOSS_LSF: SI MOI ENLEVER VOUS
EN: and if I have carried thee away with subtlety,
GENERATED_EN: If I kidnapped you by trickery,

FR: ne l'attribuez qu'à la violence de mon amour. Il est si fort que,
GLOSS_LSF: CAR MOI AMOUREUX VOUS MON AMOUR PUISSANT
GENERATED_LSF: NE VIOLENCE AMOUR ATTRIBUER SI FORT ETRE
EN: that has come to pass because of my exceeding great love for thee.
GENERATED_EN: attribute it only to the violence of my love. It is so strong that,

FR: quand j'ai vu votre portrait pour la première fois,
GLOSS_LSF: MOI VOIR VOTRE PORTRAIT PREMIERE FOIS
EN: The first time that I looked on thy portrait,
GENERATED_EN: when I first saw your portrait,

FR: j'en suis tombé sans connaissance à la renverse.
GLOSS_LSF: MOI TOMBER DANS POMME
EN: I fell fainting to the ground.
GENERATED_EN: I fell unconscious backwards.

FR: Ces paroles consolèrent la princesse;
GLOSS_LSF: CES PAROLES CONSOLER PRINCESSE
EN: When the princess of the Golden Dwelling heard that, she was comforted,
GENERATED_EN: These words comforted the princess;

FR: son coeur en fut touché,
GLOSS_LSF: COEUR TOUCHE
EN: and her heart was inclined unto him,
GENERATED_EN: his heart was touched,

FR: et elle consentit à épouser le roi.
GLOSS_LSF: ELLE ACCEPTER EPOUSER ROI
EN: so that she willingly consented to be his wife.
GENERATED_EN: and she consented to marry the king.

FR: Pendant qu'ils naviguaient en pleine mer,
GLOSS_LSF: QUAND EUX NAVIGER MER
EN: It so happened, however, while they were sailing onwards over the deep sea,
GENERATED_EN: While they were sailing on the open sea,

FR: le fidèle Jean, étant assis un jour à l'avant du navire,
GLOSS_LSF: FIDELE JEAN ASSIS AVANT BATEAU
GENERATED_LSF: FIDELE JEAN JOUR AVANT NAVIRE ASSEOIR
EN: that Faithful John, who was sitting on the fore part of the vessel,
GENERATED_EN: the faithful John, sitting one day at the front of the ship,

FR: aperçut dans l'air trois corneilles qui vinrent se poser devant lui.
GLOSS_LSF: APERCEVOIR TROIS CORNEILLES POSER DEVANT LUI
GENERATED_LSF: AIR TROIS CORNEILLES APERCUT VENIR POSER
EN: making music, saw three ravens in the air, which came flying towards them.
GENERATED_EN: saw in the air three crows that came to land in front of him.

FR: Il prêta l'oreille à ce qu'elles se disaient entre elles, car il comprenait leur langage.
GLOSS_LSF: LUI ECOUTER ELLES DIRE CAR LUI COMPRENDRE LEUR LANGUAGE
EN: On this he stopped playing and listened to what they were saying to each other, for that he well understood.
GENERATED_EN: He listened to what they said to each other, for he understood their language.

FR: Eh bien! disait la première, il emmène la princesse du Dôme d'or!
GLOSS_LSF: PREMIER OISEAU DIRE EH BIEN ! LUI EMMENER PRINCESSE DOME OR
GENERATED_LSF: BIEN PREMIERE DIRE PRINCESSE DOME OR EMMENER
EN: One cried, Oh, there he is carrying home the princess of the Golden Dwelling.
GENERATED_EN: Well! said the first, he takes the princess of the Golden Dome!

FR: Oui, répondit la seconde, mais il ne la tient pas encore.
GLOSS_LSF: DEUXIEME OISEAU REPONDRE OUI MAIS PAS ENCORE TENIR PRINCESSE
GENERATED_LSF: OUI SECONDE REPONDRE NE PAS ENCORE TENIR
EN: Yes, replied the second, but he has not got her yet.
GENERATED_EN: Yes, said the second, but he hasn't got it yet.

FR: Comment? dit la troisième; elle est assise près de lui.
GLOSS_LSF: TROISIEME OISEAU DIRE COMMENT ?
EN: Said the third, But he has got her, she is sitting beside him in the ship.
GENERATED_EN: How? said the third; she is sitting next to him.

FR: Qu'est-ce que cela lui apportera ? reprit la première,
GLOSS_LSF: PREMIERE REPRENDRE QU' EST CE QUE CELA APPORTER ROI ?
EN: Then the first began again, and cried, What good will that do him?
GENERATED_EN: What will it do for him? said the first,

FR: quand ils débarqueront, on présentera au roi un cheval roux;
GLOSS_LSF: QUAND ARRIVER SUR TERRE NOUS PRESENTER ROI CHEVAL ROUX
EN: When they reach land a chestnut horse will leap forward to meet him,
GENERATED_EN: when they disembark, a red horse will be presented to the king;

FR: il voudra le monter; mais, s'il le fait,
GLOSS_LSF: LUI VOULOIR MONTER CHEVAL MAIS SI LUI FAIRE
EN: and the prince will want to mount it, but if he does that,
GENERATED_EN: he will want to ride it; but, if he does,

FR: le cheval s'élancera dans les airs avec lui,
GLOSS_LSF: CHEVAL S' ELANCER PARTIR DANS AIR AVEC ROI
EN: it will run away with him, and rise up into the air with him,
GENERATED_EN: the horse will take off with him into the air,

FR: et il ne reverra plus jamais sa jeune fille.
GLOSS_LSF: LUI PLUS JAMAIS REVOIR JEUNE FILLE
GENERATED_LSF: NE PLUS JAMAIS JEUNE FILLE REVOIR
EN: and he will never see his maiden more.
GENERATED_EN: and he will never see his young daughter again.

FR: Mais, dit la seconde, n'y a-t-il donc aucune échapatoire?
GLOSS_LSF: MAIS DEUXIEME OISEAU DIRE AUCUN AUTRE SOLUTION ?
EN: Spake the second, But is there no escape?
GENERATED_EN: But, said the second, is there no escape?

FR: Il y en a une, dit la première, il faut qu'une autre personne s'élance sur le cheval et que,
GLOSS_LSF: PREMIER REPONDRE SI UNE SOLUTION FALLOIR QUELQU'UN AUTRE MONTER CHEVAL
GENERATED_LSF: AVOIR PREMIERE DIRE QU' AUTRE PERSONNE ELANCE CHEVAL FALLOIR
EN: Oh, yes, if any one else gets on it swiftly,
GENERATED_EN: There is one, says the first, it is necessary that another person rushes on the horse and that,

FR: saisissant dans les fontes un pistolet,
GLOSS_LSF: PRENDRE PISTOLET
EN: and takes out the pistol which must be in its holster,
GENERATED_EN: seizing in the fonts a gun,

FR: et tue le cheval.
GLOSS_LSF: TUER CHEVAL
EN: and shoots the horse dead with it,
GENERATED_EN: and kills the horse.

FR: Préservant ainsi le roi.
GLOSS_LSF: PROTEGER ROI
EN: the young King is saved.
GENERATED_EN: Thus preserving the king.

FR: Mais qui peut savoir cela?
GLOSS_LSF: MAIS QUI POUVOIR SAVOIR COMMENT FAIRE ?
EN: But who knows that?
GENERATED_EN: But who can know that?

FR: Et encore celui qui le saurait et le dirait
GLOSS_LSF: PERSONNE SAVOIR DIRE ROI
EN: And whosoever does know it, and tells it to him,
GENERATED_EN: And still the one who would know and say it

FR: serait changé en pierre depuis les pieds jusqu'aux genoux.
GLOSS_LSF: CETTE PERSONNE TRANSFORMER PIERRE PIED JUSQU' AU GENOUX
EN: will be turned to stone from the toe to the knee.
GENERATED_EN: would be turned to stone from the feet to the knees.

FR: La seconde corneille dit à son tour:
GLOSS_LSF: SECOND OISEAU DIRE
EN: Then said the second,
GENERATED_EN: The second crow said in turn:

FR: Je sais quelque chose de plus encore.
GLOSS_LSF: MOI SAVOIR UN PEU PLUS
EN: I know more than that;
GENERATED_EN: I know something more.

FR: En supposant que le cheval soit tué,
GLOSS_LSF: IMAGINER CHEVAL TUER
EN: even if the horse be killed,
GENERATED_EN: Assuming the horse is killed,

FR: le jeune roi ne possédera pas encore sa fiancée.
GLOSS_LSF: JEUNE ROI PAS ENCORE POSSEDER FIANCEE
GENERATED_LSF: JEUNE ROI NE PAS ENCORE FIANCEE POSSEDER
EN: the young King will still not keep his bride.
GENERATED_EN: the young king will not yet possess his bride.

FR: Quand ils entreront ensemble dans le palais,
GLOSS_LSF: QUAND EUX RENTRER ENSEMBLE DANS PALAIS
EN: When they go into the castle together,
GENERATED_EN: When they enter the palace together,

FR: on lui présentera sur un plat une magnifique chemise de noces
GLOSS_LSF: NOUS PRESENTER PLAT AVEC CHEMISE NOCE MAGNFIQUE DESSUS
EN: a wrought bridal garment will be lying there in a dish,
GENERATED_EN: we will present him on a plate a magnificent wedding shirt

FR: qui semblera tissue d'or et d'argent;
GLOSS_LSF: TISSUS CROIRE OR ARGENT
EN: and looking as if it were woven of gold and silver;
GENERATED_EN: which will seem to be made of gold and silver;

FR: mais elle n'est réellement que poix et soufre;
GLOSS_LSF: MAIS VRAI TISSUS POIX SOUFFRE
EN: it is, however, nothing but sulphur and pitch,
GENERATED_EN: but it is really only pitch and sulfur;

FR: si le roi la met,
GLOSS_LSF: SI ROI METTRE
EN: and if he put it on,
GENERATED_EN: if the king puts it on,

FR: elle le brûlera jusqu'à la moelle des os.
GLOSS_LSF: LUI BRULER JUSQU’ A MOELLE OS
EN: it will burn him to the very bone and marrow.
GENERATED_EN: it will burn him to the marrow of his bones.

FR: N'y a-t-il donc aucune échapatoire? dit la troisième.
GLOSS_LSF: TROISIEME DEMANDER AUCUN AUTRE SOLUTION ?
EN: Said the third, Is there no escape at all?
GENERATED_EN: Is there no escape? said the third.

FR: Il y en a une, répondit la seconde,
GLOSS_LSF: DEUXIEME REPONDRE SI UNE
EN: Oh, yes, replied the second,
GENERATED_EN: There is one, replied the second,

FR: il faut qu'une personne munie de gants saisisse la chemise et la jette au feu. La chemise brûlée,
GLOSS_LSF: FALLOIR PERSONNE AVEC GANT PRENDRE CHEMISE JETTER FEU CHEMISE BRULER
GENERATED_LSF: PERSONNE MUNIE GANTS CHEMISE JETTE FEU FALLOIR SAISIR CHEMISE BRULEE
EN: if any one with gloves on seizes the garment and throws it into the fire and burns it,
GENERATED_EN: someone with gloves must grab the shirt and throw it into the fire. The burned shirt,

FR: le roi sera sauvé.
GLOSS_LSF: ROI SAUVER
EN: the young King will be saved.
GENERATED_EN: the king will be saved.

FR: Mais à quoi sert cela?
GLOSS_LSF: MAIS A QUOI SERVIR ?
EN: But what avails that?
GENERATED_EN: But what is the point of this?

FR: Celui qui le saurait et lui dirait
GLOSS_LSF: PERSONNE SAVOIR DIRE ROI
EN: Whosoever knows it and tells it to him,
GENERATED_EN: Whoever would know and tell him

FR: se verrait changé en pierre depuis les genoux jusqu'au coeur.
GLOSS_LSF: CETTE PERSONNE TRANSFORMER PIERRE GENOUX JUSQU' AU COEUR
EN: half his body will become stone from the knee to the heart.
GENERATED_EN: would be turned to stone from the knees to the heart.

FR: La troisième corneille ajouta:
GLOSS_LSF: TROISIEME OISEAU AJOUTER
EN: Then said the third,
GENERATED_EN: The third crow added:

FR: Je sais quelque chose de plus encore.
GLOSS_LSF: MOI SAVOIR ENCORE QUELQUE CHOSE
EN: I know still more;
GENERATED_EN: I know something more.

FR: En supposant la chemise brûlée,
GLOSS_LSF: IMAGINER CHEMISE BRULER
EN: even if the bridal garment be burnt,
GENERATED_EN: Assuming the shirt is burned,

FR: le jeune roi ne possédera pas encore sa femme.
GLOSS_LSF: JEUNE ROI PAS ENCORE POSSEDER FEMME
GENERATED_LSF: JEUNE ROI NE PAS ENCORE FEMME POSSEDER
EN: the young King will still not have his bride.
GENERATED_EN: the young king will not yet possess his wife.

FR: S'il y a un bal de noces et que la jeune reine y danse,
GLOSS_LSF: SI BAL POUR NOCE JEUNE REINE DANER
GENERATED_LSF: BAL NOCES JEUNE REINE DANSE AVOIR
EN: After the wedding, when the dancing begins and the young queen is dancing,
GENERATED_EN: If there is a wedding ball and the young queen dances there,

FR: elle s'évanouira tout d'un coup et tombera comme morte;
GLOSS_LSF: ELLE S' EVANOUIR D'UN COUP TOMBER COMME MORTE
EN: she will suddenly turn pale and fall down as if dead,
GENERATED_EN: she will suddenly faint and fall as if dead;

FR: et si quelqu'un ne la relève pas aussitôt et ne lui suce pas son sein droit trois gouttes de sang qu'il crachera immédiatement
GLOSS_LSF: SI QUELQU' UN PAS RELEVER DE SUITE ET SUCER SON SEIN DROIT TROIS GOUTTES SANG CRACHER IMMEDIATEMENT
GENERATED_LSF: NE RELEVE PAS AUSSITOT NE PAS SEIN DROIT TROIS GOUTTES SANG IMMEDIATEMENT SUCER CRACHER
EN: and if some one does not lift her up and draw three drops of blood from her right breast and spit them out again,
GENERATED_EN: and if someone does not raise her immediately and suck her right breast three drops of blood he will spit out immediately

FR: elle mourra.
GLOSS_LSF: ELLE MOURIR
EN: she will die.
GENERATED_EN: she will die.

FR: Mais celui qui saurait cela et qui le dirait
GLOSS_LSF: PERSONNE SAVOIR DIRE ROI
EN: But if any one who knows that were to declare it,
GENERATED_EN: But whoever would know this and say so

FR: serait changé en pierre de la tête aux pieds.
GLOSS_LSF: CETTE PERSONNE TRANSFORMER PIERRE TETE AU PIED
EN: he would become stone from the crown of his head to the sole of his foot.
GENERATED_EN: would be turned to stone from head to toe.

FR: Après cette conversation, les corneilles reprirent leur vol.
GLOSS_LSF: APRES CONVERSATION OISEAUX REPRENDRE VOL
EN: When the ravens had spoken of this together, they flew onwards,
GENERATED_EN: After this conversation, the crows resumed their flight.

FR: Le fidèle Jean, qui avait tout entendu,
GLOSS_LSF: FIDELE JEAN TOUT ECOUTER
EN: and Faithful John had well understood everything,
GENERATED_EN: The faithful John, who had heard everything,

FR: resta depuis ce temps triste et silencieux.
GLOSS_LSF: RESTER TRISTE SILENCIEUX
EN: but from that time forth he became quiet and sad,
GENERATED_EN: remained since that time sad and silent.

FR: Se taire, c'était le malheur du roi; mais parler, c'était sa propre perte.
GLOSS_LSF: SE TAIRE DONNER MALHEUR ROI MAIS PARLER LUI-MEME MOURIR
GENERATED_LSF: TAIRE MALHEUR ROI PARLER PROPRE PERTE
EN: for if he concealed what he had heard from his master, the latter would be unfortunate, and if he discovered it to him, he himself must sacrifice his life.
GENERATED_EN: To remain silent was the king's misfortune; but to speak was his own downfall.

FR: Enfin il se dit à lui-même:
GLOSS_LSF: ENFIN FIDELE JEAN DIRE LUI-MEME
EN: At length, however, he said to himself,
GENERATED_EN: Finally he says to himself:

FR: Je sauverai mon maître, dut-il m'en coûter la vie.
GLOSS_LSF: MOI SAUVER MON MAITRE MEME SI MOI DEVOIR MOURIR
EN: I will save my master, even if it bring destruction on myself.
GENERATED_EN: I will save my master, even if it costs me my life.

FR: Au débarquement,
GLOSS_LSF: QUAND ARRIVER
EN: When therefore they came to shore,
GENERATED_EN: On landing,

FR: tout se passa comme la corneille l'avait prédit.
GLOSS_LSF: TOUT PASSER COMME OISEAU DIRE
EN: all happened as had been foretold by the ravens,
GENERATED_EN: everything happened as the crow had predicted.

FR: Un magnifique cheval roux fut présenté au roi.
GLOSS_LSF: MAGNIFIQUE CHEVAL ROUX PRESENTER DEVANT ROI
EN: and a magnificent chestnut horse sprang forward.
GENERATED_EN: A beautiful red horse was presented to the king.

FR: Bien, dit-il, je vais le monter jusqu'au palais.
GLOSS_LSF: ROI DIRE MOI MONTER CHEVAL JUSQU’ AU PALAIS
EN: Good, said the King, he shall carry me to my palace,
GENERATED_EN: Well, he said, I'll take it up to the palace.

FR: Et il allait l'enfourcher, quand le fidèle Jean, passant devant lui,
GLOSS_LSF: JUSTE PRESQUE MONTER FIDELE JEAN DOUBLER
EN: and was about to mount it when Faithful John got before him,
GENERATED_EN: And he was about to mount it, when the faithful John, passing in front of him,

FR: s'élança dessus,
GLOSS_LSF: MONTER DESSUS
EN: jumped quickly on it,
GENERATED_EN: jumped on it,

FR: tira le pistolet des fontes
GLOSS_LSF: TIRER PISTOLETS FONTES
EN: drew the pistol out of the holster,
GENERATED_EN: drew the gun from the fonts

FR: et tira sur le cheval.
GLOSS_LSF: TIER SUR CHEVAL
EN: and shot the horse.
GENERATED_EN: and shot the horse.

FR: Les autres serviteurs du roi,
GLOSS_LSF: AUTRES SERVITEURS ROI
EN: Then the other attendants of the King,
GENERATED_EN: The other servants of the king,

FR: qui n'aimaient guère le fidèle Jean, s'écrièrent qu'il fallait être fou pour tuer un si bel animal
GLOSS_LSF: PAS AIMER FIDELE JEAN CRIER LUI FOU POUR TUER MAGNFIQUE ANIMAL
GENERATED_LSF: GUERE FIDELE JEAN AIMER FOU BEL ANIMAL ECRIER FALLOIR TUER
EN: who after all were not very fond of Faithful John, cried, How shameful to kill the beautiful animal,
GENERATED_EN: who did not like the faithful John, cried out that they had to be crazy to kill such a beautiful animal

FR: que le roi allait monter.
GLOSS_LSF: ROI LUI MONTER
EN: that was to have carried the King to his palace.
GENERATED_EN: that the king was going to ride.

FR: Mais le roi leur dit: Taisez-vous, laissez-le faire;
GLOSS_LSF: ROI DIRE TAISER VOUS LAISSER JEAN FAIRE
EN: But the King said, Hold your peace and leave him alone,
GENERATED_EN: But the king said to them, Be quiet, let him do it;

FR: c'est mon fidèle, il a sans doute ses raisons pour agir ainsi.
GLOSS_LSF: LUI MON FIDELE SUREMENT LUI RAISONS POUR AGIR COMME CA
GENERATED_LSF: FIDELE DOUTE RAISONS AINSI AVOIR AGIR
EN: he is my most faithful John, who knows what may be the good of that!
GENERATED_EN: he is my loyal one, he probably has his reasons for doing so.

FR: Ils arrivèrent au palais, et, dans la première salle, la chemise de noces était posée sur un plat; il semblait qu'elle fût d'or et d'argent.
GLOSS_LSF: ARRIVER PALAIS PREMIERE SALLE CHEMISE NOCE POSER SUR PLAT CHEMISE COMME FAITE OR ARGENT
GENERATED_LSF: ARRIVERENT PALAIS PREMIERE SALLE CHEMISE NOCES PLAT POSEE OR ARGENT SEMBLER ETRE
EN: They went into the palace, and in the hall there stood a dish, and therein lay the bridal garment looking no otherwise than as if it were made of gold and silver.
GENERATED_EN: They arrived at the palace, and in the first room, the wedding shirt was placed on a plate; it seemed to be of gold and silver.

FR: Le prince allait y toucher, mais le fidèle Jean le repoussa,
GLOSS_LSF: PRINCE JUSTE PRESQUE TOUCHER FIDELE JEAN POUSSER
GENERATED_LSF: PRINCE ALLER TOUCHER FIDELE JEAN REPOUSSA
EN: The young King went towards it and was about to take hold of it, but Faithful John pushed him away,
GENERATED_EN: The prince was about to touch it, but the faithful John pushed him away,

FR: et, la saisissant avec des gants, il la jeta au feu qui la consuma à l'instant même.
GLOSS_LSF: PRENDRE AVEC GANTS JETER DANS FEU BRULER DE SUITE
GENERATED_LSF: GANTS SAISISSANT JETA FEU INSTANT MEME CONSUMER
EN: seized it with gloves on, carried it quickly to the fire and burnt it.
GENERATED_EN: and, seizing it with gloves, he threw it into the fire which consumed it at once.

FR: Les autres serviteurs se mirent à murmurer:
GLOSS_LSF: AUTRES SERVITEURS MURMURER
EN: The other attendants again began to murmur,
GENERATED_EN: The other servants began to murmur:

FR: Voyez, disaient-ils, le voilà qui brûle la chemise de noces du roi.
GLOSS_LSF: EUX DIRE VOIR MAINTENANT LUI BRULER CHEMISE NOCE ROI
GENERATED_LSF: VOYEZ DIRE VOILA CHEMISE NOCES ROI BRULE
EN: and said, Behold, now he is even burning the King's bridal garment!
GENERATED_EN: See, they said, here he is burning the king's wedding shirt.

FR: Mais le jeune roi répéta encore: Il a sans doute ses raisons. Laissez-le faire;
GLOSS_LSF: ROI REPETER ENCORE LUI SUREMENT SES RAISONS LAISSER LE FAIRE
GENERATED_LSF: JEUNE ROI ENCORE REPETER DOUTE RAISONS AVOIR LAISSEZ FAIRE
EN: But the young King said, Who knows what good he may have done, leave him alone,
GENERATED_EN: But the young king repeated again: He has his reasons, no doubt. Let him do it;

FR: c'est mon fidèle.
GLOSS_LSF: LUI MON FIDELE
EN: he is my most faithful John.
GENERATED_EN: it's my faithful.

FR: On célébra les noces. Il y eut un grand bal et la mariée commença à danser
GLOSS_LSF: CELEBRER MARIAGE GRAND BAL MARIEE COMMENCER DANSER
GENERATED_LSF: NOCES CELEBRER GRAND BAL COMMENCA AVOIR MARIEE DANSER
EN: And now the wedding was solemnized: the dance began, and the bride also took part in it;
GENERATED_EN: The wedding was celebrated. There was a big ball and the bride started to dance

FR: Dans ce moment le fidèle Jean ne la perdit pas des yeux.
GLOSS_LSF: CE MOMENT FIDELE JEAN PAS LACHER REGARD
GENERATED_LSF: MOMENT FIDELE JEAN NE PAS YEUX PERDRE
EN: then Faithful John was watchful and looked into her face,
GENERATED_EN: In this moment the faithful John did not lose sight of her.

FR: Tout à coup il lui prit une faiblesse et elle tomba comme une morte à la renverse.
GLOSS_LSF: D' UN COUP ELLE FAIBLESSE TOMBER COMME MORTE
GENERATED_LSF: TOUT FAIBLESSE MORTE RENVERSE COUP PRENDRE TOMBA
EN: and suddenly she turned pale and fell to the ground, as if she were dead.
GENERATED_EN: Suddenly she felt weak and fell backwards like a dead woman.

FR: Se jetant sur elle aussitôt, il la releva et la porta dans sa chambre, et là, l'ayant couchée sur son lit, il se pencha sur elle
GLOSS_LSF: JEAN JETER SUR ELLE DE SUITE RELEVER PORTER DANS SA CHAMBRE COUCHER SUR LIT PENCHER SUR ELLE
GENERATED_LSF: AUSSITOT JETANT RELEVA PORTA CHAMBRE LA LIT COUCHEE PENCHER
EN: On this he ran hastily to her, lifted her up and bore her into a chamber then he laid her down,
GENERATED_EN: Throwing himself upon her at once, he raised her up and carried her to his room, and there, having laid her down on his bed, he bent over her

FR: et lui suça le sein droit trois gouttes de sang
GLOSS_LSF: SUCER SEIN DROIT TROIS GOUTTES SANG
EN: and knelt and sucked the three drops of blood from her right breast,
GENERATED_EN: and sucked her right breast three drops of blood

FR: et les cracha.
GLOSS_LSF: CRACHER
EN: and spat them out.
GENERATED_EN: and spit them out.

FR: A l'instant même elle respira et reprit connaissance;
GLOSS_LSF: MEME MOMENT ELLE RESPIRER REPRENDRE CONNAISSANCE
EN: Immediately she breathed again and recovered herself,
GENERATED_EN: At the same time she breathed and regained consciousness;

FR: mais le jeune roi, qui avait tout vu
GLOSS_LSF: MAIS JEUNE ROI TOUT VOIR
EN: but the young King had seen this,
GENERATED_EN: but the young king, who had seen everything

FR: et qui ne comprenait rien à la conduite de Jean,
GLOSS_LSF: RIEN COMPRENDRE COMPORTEMENT JEAN
EN: and being ignorant why Faithful John had done it,
GENERATED_EN: and who did not understand anything about John's conduct,

FR: finit par s'en courroucer
GLOSS_LSF: ENFIN LUI S' ENERVER
EN: was angry and cried,
GENERATED_EN: ends up being angry about it

FR: et le fit jeter en prison.
GLOSS_LSF: JETER PRISON
EN: Throw him into a dungeon.
GENERATED_EN: and had him thrown into prison.

FR: Le lendemain, le fidèle Jean fut condamné à mort
GLOSS_LSF: LENDEMAIN FIDELE JEAN CONDAMNER MORT
EN: Next morning Faithful John was condemned,
GENERATED_EN: The next day, the faithful John was sentenced to death

FR: et conduit à la potence.
GLOSS_LSF: AMENER POTENCE
EN: and led to the gallows,
GENERATED_EN: and led to the gallows.

FR: Étant déjà monté à l'échelle,
GLOSS_LSF: FIDELE JEAN MONTER SUR ECHELLE
EN: and when he stood on high, and was about to be executed,
GENERATED_EN: Having already climbed the ladder,

FR: il dit: Tout homme qui va mourir peut parler avant sa fin;
GLOSS_LSF: SERVITEUR DIRE TOUT HOMME BIENTOT MOURIR POUVOIR PARLER AVANT FIN
GENERATED_LSF: DIRE HOMME FIN ALLER MOURIR POUVOIR PARLER
EN: he said, Every one who has to die is permitted before his end to make one last speech;
GENERATED_EN: he says: Any man who is going to die can speak before his end;

FR: Puis-je en réclamer le droit?
GLOSS_LSF: MOI POUVOIR ?
EN: may I too claim the right?
GENERATED_EN: Can I claim the right?

FR: Je te l'accorde, dit le roi.
GLOSS_LSF: ROI DIRE MOI ACCORDER
EN: Yes, answered the King, it shall be granted unto thee.
GENERATED_EN: I'll give it to you, says the king.

FR: Eh bien! on m'a condamné injustement, et je n'ai pas cessé de l'être fidèle.
GLOSS_LSF: EH BIEN ! MOI CONDAMNER INJUSTE MOI TOUJOURS FIDELE
GENERATED_LSF: BIEN CONDAMNE INJUSTEMER PAS ETRE FIDELE CESSE
EN: Then said Faithful John, I am unjustly condemned, and have always been true to thee,
GENERATED_EN: Well, I was condemned unjustly, and I have not stopped being faithful.

FR: Alors il raconta comment il avait entendu sur mer la conversation des corneilles,
GLOSS_LSF: ALORS FIDELE JEAN RACONTER COMMENT LUI ENTENDRE SUR MER CONVERSATION OISEAUX
GENERATED_LSF: ALORS COMMENT CONVERSATION CORNEILLES RACONTER ENTENDU MER
EN: and he related how he had hearkened to the conversation of the ravens when on the sea,
GENERATED_EN: Then he told how he had heard the conversation of the crows at sea,

FR: et comment tout ce qu'il avait fait était nécessaire pour sauver son maître.
GLOSS_LSF: COMMENT TOUT LUI FAIRE NECESSAIRE POUR SAUVER SON MAITRE
GENERATED_LSF: COMMENT TOUT NECESSAIRE MAITRE FAIT SAUVER
EN: and how he had been obliged to do all these things in order to save his master.
GENERATED_EN: and how everything he had done was necessary to save his master.

FR: 0 mon fidèle Jean, s'écria le roi, je te fais grâce. Faites-le descendre.
GLOSS_LSF: ROI REPONDRE O MON FIDELE JEAN MOI EPARGNER MORT FAIRE DESCENDRE FIDELE JEAN !
GENERATED_LSF: 0 FIDELE JEAN ROI ECRIER GRACE TE FAIRE FAITES DESCENDRE
EN: Then cried the King, Oh, my most Faithful John. Pardon, pardon bring him down.
GENERATED_EN: 0 my faithful John, cried the king, I am doing you a favor. Bring him down.

FR: Mais, au dernier mot qu'il avait prononcé, le fidèle Jean était tombé sans vie: il était changé en pierre.
GLOSS_LSF: MAIS DERNIER MOT FIDELE JEAN PRONONCER LUI MOURIR TRANSFORMER PIERRE
GENERATED_LSF: DERNIER MOT PRONONCE FIDELE JEAN VIE TOMBE PIERRE CHANGE
EN: But as Faithful John spoke the last word he had fallen down lifeless and become a stone.
GENERATED_EN: But at the last word he spoke, the faithful John had fallen lifeless: he had turned to stone.

FR: Le roi et la reine en eurent un grand chagrin:
GLOSS_LSF: ROI REINE ENORME CHAGRIN
EN: Thereupon the King and the Queen suffered great anguish,
GENERATED_EN: The king and the queen were very upset:

FR: Hélas! disait le roi,
GLOSS_LSF: ROI DIRE HELAS
EN: and the King said,
GENERATED_EN: Alas! said the king,

FR: tant de dévouement a été bien mal récompensé.
GLOSS_LSF: LUI DEVOUMENT POUR MOI MAL RECOMPENSER
EN: Ah, how ill I have requited great fidelity!
GENERATED_EN: so much dedication has been poorly rewarded.

FR: Il fit porter la statue de pierre dans sa chambre à coucher, près de son lit.
GLOSS_LSF: AMENER STATUE PIERRE DANS SA CHAMBRE PRES SON LIT
GENERATED_LSF: STATUE PIERRE CHAMBRE FAIRE PORTER COUCHER PRES LIT
EN: and ordered the stone figure to be taken up and placed in his bedroom beside his bed.
GENERATED_EN: He had the stone statue brought to his bedroom, near his bed.

FR: Chaque fois qu'il la voyait, il répétait en pleurant:
GLOSS_LSF: CHAQUE FOIS LUI VOIR STATUE ROI REPETER PLEURANT
EN: And as often as he looked on it he wept and said,
GENERATED_EN: Every time he saw her, he would repeat with tears:

FR: Hélas! mon fidèle Jean, que ne puis-je te rendre la vie!
GLOSS_LSF: HELAS MON FIDELE JEAN MOI IMPOSIBLE RENDRE TA VIE
EN: Ah, if I could bring thee to life again, my most faithful John.
GENERATED_EN: Alas, my faithful John, how can I not give you back your life!

FR: Au bout de quelque temps, la reine mit au monde deux fils jumeaux qu'elle éleva heureusement et qui furent la joie de leurs parents.
GLOSS_LSF: APRES QUELQUES TEMPS REINE NAITRE DEUX JUMEAUX ELLE ELEVER HEUREUSE EUX APPORTER JOIE LEUR PARENTS
GENERATED_LSF: BOUT TEMPS REINE MONDE DEUX FILS JUMEAUX HEUREUSEMENT JOIE PARENTS METTRE ELEVA
EN: Some time passed and the Queen bore twins, two sons who grew fast and were her delight.
GENERATED_EN: After some time, the queen gave birth to two twin sons whom she happily raised and who were the joy of their parents.

FR: Un jour que la reine était à l'église,
GLOSS_LSF: UN JOUR REINE DANS EGLISE
EN: Once when the Queen was at church
GENERATED_EN: One day the queen was in church,

FR: et que les deux enfants jouaient dans la chambre avec leur père,
GLOSS_LSF: DEUX ENFANTS JOUER DANS CHAMBRE AVEC LEUR PERE
EN: and the two children were sitting playing beside their father,
GENERATED_EN: and the two children were playing in the room with their father,

FR: les yeux du roi tombèrent sur la statue,
GLOSS_LSF: YEUX ROI TOMBER SUR STATUE
EN: the latter full of grief again looked at the stone figure,
GENERATED_EN: the eyes of the king fell on the statue,

FR: et il ne put s'empêcher de répéter encore en soupirant:
GLOSS_LSF: PAS S' EMPECHER REPETER ENCORE SOUPIRANT
GENERATED_LSF: NE PUT ENCORE EMPECHER REPETER SOUPIRANT
EN: sighed and said,
GENERATED_EN: and he couldn't help but repeat again with a sigh:

FR: Hélas! mon fidèle Jean, que ne puis-je te rendre la vie!
GLOSS_LSF: HELAS MON FIDELE JEAN MOI IMPOSIBLE RENDRE TA VIE
EN: Ah, if I could but bring thee to life again, my most faithful John.
GENERATED_EN: Alas, my faithful John, how can I not give you back your life!

FR: Mais la statue, prenant la parole lui dit:
GLOSS_LSF: MAIS STATUE PARLER DIRE
EN: Then the stone began to speak and said,
GENERATED_EN: But the statue, taking the word says to him:

FR: Tu le peux, si tu veux y consacrer ce que tu as de plus cher.
GLOSS_LSF: TOI POUVOIR SI TOI VOULOIR CONSACRER TOI AVOIR PLUS CHER
GENERATED_LSF: PEUX TOI VEUX TOI AS PLUS CHER CONSACRER
EN: Thou canst bring me to life again if thou wilt use for that purpose what is dearest to thee.
GENERATED_EN: You can, if you want to devote your most precious thing to it.

FR: Tout ce que je possède au monde, s'écria le roi, je le sacrifierais pour toi.
GLOSS_LSF: ROI CRIER TOUT MOI AVOIR SACRIFIER POUR TOI
GENERATED_LSF: TOUT MONDE POSSEDER ROI ECRIER SACRIFIERAIS
EN: Then cried the King, I will give everything I have in the world for thee.
GENERATED_EN: All that I possess in the world, exclaimed the king, I would sacrifice for you.

FR: Eh bien! dit la statue,
GLOSS_LSF: STATUE DIRE EH BIEN !
EN: The stone continued,
GENERATED_EN: Well! says the statue,

FR: pour que je recouvre l'existence, il faut que tu coupes la tête à tes deux fils, et que tu me frottes tout entier avec leur sang.
GLOSS_LSF: POUR MOI VIVRE TOI DEVOIR COUPER TETE DEUX FILS FROTTER ENTIER AVEC LEUR SANG
GENERATED_LSF: EXISTENCE RECOUVRIR TOI COUPES TETE TES DEUX FILS FALLOIR TOI TOUT ENTIER SANG FROTTES
EN: If thou wilt will cut off the heads of thy two children with thine own hand, and sprinkle me with their blood, I shall be restored to life.
GENERATED_EN: so that I recover the existence, it is necessary that you cut the head to your two sons, and that you rub me whole with their blood.

FR: Le roi pâlit en entendant qu’il devait lui même tuer ses chers enfants.
GLOSS_LSF: ROI DEVENIR PALE ENTENDRE LUI-MEME DEVOIR TUER SES ENFANTS
GENERATED_LSF: ROI PALIT MEME CHERS ENFANTS ENTENDANT DEVOIR TUER
EN: The King was terrified when he heard that he himself must kill his dearest children,
GENERATED_EN: The king turned pale when he heard that he himself had to kill his dear children.

FR: mais songeant au dévouement de ce fidèle serviteur
GLOSS_LSF: MAIS PENSER DEVOUEMENT FIDELE SERVITEUR
EN: but he thought of faithful John's great fidelity,
GENERATED_EN: but thinking of the dedication of this faithful servant

FR: qui avait donné sa vie pour lui,
GLOSS_LSF: LUI DONNER VIE POUR ROI
EN: and how he had died for him,
GENERATED_EN: who had given his life for him,

FR: il tira son épée,
GLOSS_LSF: TIRER SON EPEE
EN: drew his sword,
GENERATED_EN: he drew his sword,

FR: et, de sa propre main, il coupa la tète de ses enfants
GLOSS_LSF: SA PROPRE MAIN COUPER TETE ENFANTS
EN: and with his own hand cut off the children's heads.
GENERATED_EN: and with his own hand he cut off the heads of his children

FR: et frotta la pierre avec leur sang.
GLOSS_LSF: FROTTER PIERRE AVEC SANG
EN: And when he had smeared the stone with their blood,
GENERATED_EN: and rubbed the stone with their blood.

FR: A l'instant même la statue se ranima,
GLOSS_LSF: MEME MOMENT STATUE REANIMER
EN: life returned to it,
GENERATED_EN: At that very moment the statue came to life,

FR: et le fidèle Jean apparut frais et dispos devant lui.
GLOSS_LSF: FIDELE JEAN FRAIS APPARAITRE DEVANT LUI
EN: and Faithful John stood once more safe and healthy before him.
GENERATED_EN: and the faithful John appeared fresh and ready before him.

FR: Mais il dit au roi:
GLOSS_LSF: MAIS DIRE ROI
EN: He said to the King,
GENERATED_EN: But he said to the king:

FR: Ton dévouement pour moi aura sa récompense.
GLOSS_LSF: TON DEVOUEMENT POUR MOI AVOIR SA RECOMPENSE
EN: Thy truth shall not go unrewarded,
GENERATED_EN: Your dedication to me will have its reward.

FR: Et, prenant les têtes des enfants,
GLOSS_LSF: PRENDRE TETE ENFANTS
EN: and took the heads of the children,
GENERATED_EN: And, taking the heads of the children,

FR: il les replaça sur leurs épaules et frotta les blessures avec leur sang;
GLOSS_LSF: REPLACER SUR EPAULES ENFANTS FROTTER BLESSURES AVEC LEUR SANG
EN: put them on again, and rubbed the wounds with their blood,
GENERATED_EN: He placed them back on their shoulders and rubbed the wounds with their blood;

FR: au même moment ils revinrent à la vie,
GLOSS_LSF: MEME MOMENT ENFANTS REVENIR VIE
EN: on which they became whole again immediately,
GENERATED_EN: at the same time they came back to life,

FR: et se remirent à sauter et à jouer,
GLOSS_LSF: REPRENDRE SAUTER  JOUER
EN: and jumped about, and went on playing
GENERATED_EN: and began to jump and play again,

FR: comme si rien n'était arrivé.
GLOSS_LSF: COMME SI RIEN PASSER
EN: as if nothing had happened.
GENERATED_EN: as if nothing had happened.

FR: Le roi était plein de joie.
